column4: does anyone know if you can backup or save pidgin user logs ?
well, i'm installing a new distro
but i just wanted to back them up and keep them for records
garrett: how ?
i can't access them in that format
i would have to go throuh and copy/paste text
i don't want to do that
uh... what?
pidgin has native support for conversation logs, no?
or do you mean once it's logged, some way to automatically back it up?
just upload them somewhere
well, you could, for example, make a .tar file of them or a .zip or whatever and upload them to divshare?
or you could burn them to cd?
your logs are stored as text files
wait.. what?
they're not logged anywhere if you aven't enabled logging
no, this is why you ate yourself
check your homedir
look in your ~/.purple directory.  find what you want.  make an archive of it.  upload tat somewhere.
and just as a heads up, think through what you ask a little bit.  like, imagine you were writing a quick email to someone and you wanted to give tem all the facts so they could work from that
it helps prevent miscommuncations and frustration
where does gaim store log files would have been a better question
